philosophers.accessdate: 7 March 2013}} he came to be considered one of the great rationalists of 17th-century philosophy. Along with René Descartes, Spinoza was a leading philosophical figure of the Dutch Golden Age. Spinoza's given name, which means "Blessed", varies among different languages. In Hebrew, it is written {{lang|he-n|ברוך שפינוזה}}. His Portuguese name is {{lang|pt|Benedito "Bento" de Espinosa}}. In his Latin works, he used {{lang-la|Benedictus de Spinoza|links=no}}.

philosophers.name: Alexander Wendt

philosophers.known_for: Constructivism (international relations)
philosophers.influences: Anthony Giddens, Roy Bhaskar
philosophers.website: }}'''Alexander Wendt''' (born 12 June 1958 in Mainz, West Germany) is a political scientist who is one of the core social constructivist scholars in the field of international relations. Wendt and scholars such as Nicholas Onuf, Peter J. Katzenstein, Emanuel Adler, Michael Barnett, Kathryn Sikkink, John Ruggie, Martha Finnemore, and others have, within a relatively short period, established constructivism as one of the major schools of thought in the field. A 2006 survey of American and Canadian International Relations scholars ranks Wendt as first among scholars who have "been doing the most interesting work in international relations in recent years." A 2011 survey of International Relations scholars worldwide ranked Wendt first in terms of having "produced the best work in the field of IR in the past 20 years".{{Cite web|url=https://www.wm.edu/offices/itpir/_documents/trip/trip_around_the_world_2011.pdf|title=TRIP AROUND THE WORLD: Teaching, Research, and Policy Views of International Relations Faculty in 20 Countries|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}
